intro: Calycothrix asperula, commonly known as the rough-leaved marsh plant, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its inflorescence consists of a spiky, cylindrical structure known as a spikelet. Calycothrix asperula plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
